column4: hi guys :) i cannot switch users from xscreensaver. choosing "switch user" button returns me to screensaver. WTF. this is an intermittent problem i first noticed about a week ago. fuck-up in xscreensaver or gdm?
any idea how that actually works? ie, does it start up gdm on vt8 or what?
how does the signalling work? dbus?
good question
you used a dirty wordy.
that's ok, i was being friendly, and i'm 12
he's using gparted. he has some sort of gui problem. a "lock" icon he said.
oh; ok.
there's a simpler way to test that. telnet 192.168.0.110 3389
nmap is, unsurprisingly, not always installed on people's machines :P
you have no idea how angry it makes me that a basic version of nmap isn't installed by default. for that matter, the host(1) command isn't either
host, yeah, that'd bug me. good reasons not to have nmap ;)
why good reasons not to have nmap? i would accept not dragging in lua etc.
well; if it's there, naughty people will use it. :)
I agree in principle; most of hmy machines have nmap installed because it's really useful. but yeah. not the best thing to put in a default install.
i don't understand what can go wrong using nmap... what ports are open to me is like index.html
she just wants to rdp but it's not open to other LAN computers
or she's trying to use the wrong tool for the job.
ah, good question. i just assume if someone wants rdp, that's what they want.
good eye.. i would have never thought it wasn't ubuntu for some reason...
ok, so is there any rdesktop -server- for ubuntu or a reason to use one on ubuntu?
dunno, scarcely ever used rdp
